Stuart (DPD Group) is a sustainable last-mile logistics company that connects retailers and e-merchants to a fleet of geolocalised couriers across several countries in Europe. Our Mission We are an impact-driven company that aims to build the future of logistics for a more sustainable world: shared, efficient and reliable. We are committed to creating a new standard for urban deliveries that meet today’s environmental and social challenges while offering a premium delivery experience blending speed, flexibility and convenience.   Our motto: “Make every delivery a moment all of us can truly celebrate!” More than 3000+ leading brands already partner with us across Restaurants, Grocery, Retail & Luxury, eCommerce and Professional Services to deliver all types of goods at the tap of a button. Stuart is a highly diverse and inclusive company of 600+ talents from 90+ countries working in Paris , London , Barcelona, Madrid , Poland , Portugal and remotely around the world It’s the right moment and the right place for us to make an impact on millions of people, as home delivery services hit a record high. And guess what? You can help us fulfil our vision Let's talk about the Product Analytics Team ️ The Product Analytics team belongs to the Data Department. Our vision is to enable a data-driven decision-making culture at Stuart. We want to reduce the lead time to insight in the company by ensuring the availability, reliability, and accessibility of the data across all teams and countries at Stuart.   As the  Head of Product Analytics,  you will be managing and growing a team responsible for analyzing the performance of our technologies and algorithms and the way they impact our business as well as couriers and clients. In this key role for the success of our business, you will be required to build strong relationships with different stakeholders, both on the technical side (Data Science, Engineering, Product Management) and on the business side (Operations). Together with them you will identify and prioritize analytical work that will have the biggest impact on the business. We are looking for someone with a strong technical background that loves the challenge of managing complex projects in a fast-paced environment while building and leading a team of talented cross-country analysts. You will report directly to Daniele Garbarino, our Chief Data Officer.  What will I be doing? Organizing the Product Analytics team structure and processes to best support your stakeholders and reach the team’s goals. Analyzing the performance of our technologies and algorithms, with particular focus on the impact of newly released features. Defining KPIs and health metrics for assessing and monitoring our products. Contributing to the development of a tracking framework for our technology. Collaborating with Product Managers to prioritize and roadmap efforts by contributing to cost/benefit analyses. Collaborating with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to set up and run lab and live testing.  What do we need from you? Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics or equivalent. Extensive experience in previous analytical roles and managing teams of 5+ individual contributors. Advanced SQL skills and working knowledge of data warehousing concepts. Good knowledge of Python. Experience with tracking methodologies and software. Advanced Google Sheets/Excel skills. Advanced knowledge of Tableau or similar reporting tools.  The stuff you wanna know Family-friendly work-life balance -  work from home and flexible hours Ticket Restaurant by  Swile  (FR) or  Edenred  (SP) Unlimited access to  Udemy  for all your learning and development needs Stuart Academy  with regular workshops, Stu-Classes, and Stu-Talks Stuart is putting Mental Health Awareness first! Wellness Allowance (€40 monthly) to use in any gym or sport class Private healthcare  provided by Alan (FR) or Sanitas (SP) ‍ ️ Free monthly  Navigo card  (FR) or  Bicing  (SP)   for non-remote workers Work in an international, dynamic and passionate environment with a company culture focused on learning and development  You’ve read all this way but you’re missing a skill or two? No problem, it’s our job to up-skill you to take your career to the next level. What we’re trying to say is, don’t be afraid to apply if you don’t tick all the boxes At Stuart, we believe that employees today want to evolve in collaborative, high-growth environments where they can demonstrate their abilities and thrive both professionally and personally. We are convinced that employees need to find alignment between their inner values and their company’s culture and mission to unlock their full potential. We work to create a culture of empowerment, continuous learning and growth where everyone can bring expertise, own projects and easily measure their impact Stuart is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status Want to learn more about us? Visit https://stuart.com/about-us/

job_title: Research Data Analyst 2 or 3 (Research Associate / Senior Research Associate)
location: 3181 SW Sam Jackson Park Rd, Portland, OR 97239
job_Description: Department Overview: The Cancer Early Detection Advanced Research (CEDAR) center is a collaborative institution within the OHSU Knight Cancer Institute. The Knight Cancer Institute, known as one of the pioneers in personalized cancer medicine, is an international leader in research and cancer treatment. At CEDAR our mission is to detect and stop lethal cancers at the earliest stage because early detection saves lives. This is an ambitious goal, one that requires novelty, creativity, and innovation. We are comprised of biologists, chemists, biomedical engineers, computationalists, and clinicians conducting groundbreaking translational cancer research to help people maintain a high quality of life and reduce cancer mortality, to create a global early detection community, and to have a positive impact on the Oregon economy. CEDAR is committed to increasing the diversity of the campus community. We are dedicated to promoting inclusion and multiculturalism by having outstanding researchers of diverse backgrounds work together on multiple projects. We encourage high-risk, high-reward research projects because defeating cancer requires out-of-the-box thinking and new perspectives. Our research is milestone driven to ensure that each project is fulfilling its stated goals. Every Knight Cancer employee is expected to embody our guiding principles: We act BOLDLY—Breakthroughs require pushing the boundaries of science, exploring new frontiers, and thinking differently We SUPPORT each other—Respect leads to trust, which leads to excellence We work as a CONNECTED team—We must leverage our collective brain power to conquer cancer because no one individual can do it alone Function/Duties of Position: Cancer Early Detection Advanced Research Center (CEDAR) is currently looking to recruit an outstanding Research Data Analyst to support our researchers and research operations teams.  Clinical Data Support Work independently and with study team members to obtain, abstract, and code complex clinical information from multiple sources (medical records, research records, etc.) for research subjects and studies Responsible for day-to-day coordination and overall management of activities related to data completion and quality, transformation, de-identification (as needed), integration and data-capture system maintenance. Example platforms include LabVantage, REDCap, and CEDAR-x drive Write and execute queries against various OHSU enterprise data sources and/or work directly with database analysts to develop and execute queries. Enterprise data includes, but is not limited to, Epic, OHSU’s Research Data Warehouse datamarts, Cohort Discovery Tool, cancer registry, NSQIP, and Web Intelligence Act as data analyst to interact with CEDAR researchers, OHSU, and external database managers and technical support to understand data needs, request and obtain data, share data, and resolve technical issues Understand and comply with all regulatory and institutional review board expectations for uses and sharing of clinical research data. Understand the allowances and limitations of protocols; maintain records of data access and release by protocol May assist researchers and study teams with the preparation and analysis of study-related clinical data for publication and grant applications. May include data prep for statistical analysis, data tables for manuscripts, audit data or other presentations Operational / Programmatic Data Support Maintain, configure and improve CEDAR’s programmatic grants management platform and data capture tools along with noted stakeholders including CEDAR leadership and operational team. Example platforms include SmartSimple, SmartSheets, Sharepoint, and others Work closely with Program Director and others to implement tactical plans to advance CEDAR initiatives Resolve problems, complete audits, identify trends, determine systemimprovements and implement change Implement production, productivity, quality and customer service standards into CEDAR’s operational data capture tools Achieve operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations Coordinate communication with various software vendors, contractors and technical support to make improvements and resolve technical issues with data capture tools General Establish and promote positive working relationships within CEDAR, the Knight Cancer Institute, OHSU and external collaborators Uphold CEDAR’s mission to detect and stop lethal cancers early Required Qualifications: PhD in relevant field OR Master's Degree in relevant field AND 4 years of relevant experience OR Bachelor's Degree in relevant field AND 6 years of relevant experience OR Equivalent combination of training and experience will be considered at the Research Data Analyst 3 / Sr. Research Associate level Applicants with a Master's Degree in relevant field AND 2 years of relevant experience OR Bachelor's Degree in relevant field AND 4 years of relevant experience OR Equivalent combination of training and experience will be considered at the Research Data Analyst 2 / Research Associate level 5+ years in data management (relational, object and hierarchical databases)  3+ years experience with SQL, REDCap; use of data capture tools and tools used to extract data from databases 3+ years experience with medical records data; data capture from Epic or other electronic medical record system Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel ( e.g., Analytical and statistical formulas, VLOOKUP, conditional formatting, Pivot tables, charts, reporting) Proficient in writing and executing SQL queries against databases; working knowledge of Oracle SQL Able to collect and manage large amounts of data and maintain databases Effectively communicates progress, challenges and results Knowledge of medical terminology, particularly cancer terminologies Ability to work independently with little direct supervision Highly organized and attentive to details; able to prioritize and execute on assigned tasks Able to work with diverse teams across CEDAR, Knight Cancer Institute and OHSU  Preferred Qualifications: 3+ years in biomedical research setting 1+ years project management experience  3+ years experience with human subjects research (clinical trials, HIPAA compliance and protocol adherence) Experience with workflow management software and/or grants management software (Sharepoint, WizeHive, Submittable, Salesforce, Smartsimple, etc) Able to advise on and help write protocols to handle (collect, reposit, and release) protected health information Able to assess processes and practices, make and implement recommendations to improve them Experience with data visualization (Tableau or R) Additional Details: Apply online. Please be sure to upload a Cover Letter and Resume/CV. Effective Oct. 18, 2021, all OHSU employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless they have an approved medical or religious exception. If you are hired by OHSU, you will need to be fully vaccinated (or obtain an approved exception) prior to starting work, and need to provide proof of vaccination (or approved exception) within 10 days of starting work. #linkedin All are welcome: Oregon Health & Science University values a diverse and culturally competent workforce. We are proud of our commitment to being an equal opportunity, affirmative action organization that does not discriminate against applicants on the basis of any protected class status, including disability status and protected veteran status. Individuals with diverse backgrounds and those who promote diversity and a culture of inclusion are encouraged to apply. To request reasonable accommodation contact the Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Department at  503-494-5148  or aaeo@ohsu.edu.  As an organization devoted to the health and well-being of people in Oregon and beyond, OHSU requires its employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

job_title: Mergers & Acquisitions - Data Analytics Advisory Manager
job_Description: Are you looking for a fast-paced, exciting and dynamic work environment to challenge your existing skills? Are you interested in developing innovative solutions to solve complex business issues? If so, Deloitte is seeking Manager level candidates for its M&A Transactions Services Analytics practice.  Today's M&A due diligence environment generates vast volumes of data and information, and almost all of this information is captured and stored in computerized form.  Our clients include Fortune 500 companies in technology, financial services and banking sectors, health care, telecommunications and other industries, as well as the most dynamic private equity firms in the world.   Work you'll do  Candidates will be responsible for filling the following role.  First, you will be key member of client deal teams through gathering, normalizing, validating and analyzing transactional data (e.g., sales and inventory data) to develop and test hypotheses for a given deal. You will work as part of cross-functional teams providing financial, accounting, operational and tax due diligence, bringing your skills to the deal to manage and analyze the data, and utilize your visual analytics skills to tell a compelling story of our findings.  Second, you will be at the heart of a firm-wide initiative to develop, refine and extend innovative methodologies and approaches to analyze transactional data as part of M&A due diligence. You will use your database, visualization and development skills to design analyses in various industries to make difficult work repeatable across M&A engagements.  A candidate can expect to do some or all of the following:  Coordinate with IT personnel to identify, collect and validate data from databases. Analyze deal data for trends and outliers. Identify opportunities to design and develop visualizations and dashboards that enable effective and repeatable analysis of large transactional datasets. Work with deal team leaders to identify requirements, design, implement and test analytical methods and solutions. Provide input to technology initiatives and investments across the M&A lifecycle. Team members collaborate with other transaction service analytics professionals, members of the deal teams and clients to produce analyses within fast-paced transaction deadlines. This is not a "back-office" position; this is front-line client interaction with significant opportunity for growth and advancement.   Qualifications  Required:  Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering 5+ years of experience analyzing large datasets Demonstrated knowledge or advanced business analytics and data mining solutions Solid understanding of multiple business cycles (Accounts Receivable/ Payables, Fixed Assets, Supply Chain, Inventory, etc.) Experience designing interactive visual interfaces (such as Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView) Tools to perform data ETL (Extract, Transform and Load), particularly Alteryx Experience analyzing or managing accounting, financial or transactional data Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential, as well as demonstrable evidence of effective team leadership, client relationship development and engagement management, preferably in a client service setting. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future Preferred:  Master of Business Administration or Masters in Data Science Strong working knowledge of relational databases (SQL Server 2014 & 2017, Microsoft Access, OLAP or other proprietary software) Practical application of machine learning algorithms and predictive analytics Statistical methods in support of data analysis Experience with R and/or Python CPA, CA certification      The team  An in-depth understanding of the M&A landscape, market experience, and access to our global network of advisors means we have the capabilities to help clients confidently pursue strategic transactions in both domestic and global markets - this includes managing the entire M&A lifecycle. Working with our clients to develop growth strategies based on their organizational goals, our services are designed to help clients be prepared to capitalize on opportunities during the merger, acquisition or divestiture process. Learn more about Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory's Mergers and Acquisition practice.  You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

Hi, We’re AppFolio. We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a software company — we’re a cloud-based Software company that creates products to make our customers’ lives easier. We’re revolutionizing the way people do business, and we want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion to help us keep on innovating. We love where we work, and you can, too. Whom we are looking for: We are hiring a Data Engineer to contribute to our growing Data Operations team. We work collaboratively to set the technical direction for our Data Platform, developing easy-to-use solutions for our customers. You’ll get the opportunity to work to develop, design, and operate all aspects of the Data Platform infrastructure. This is an ideal opportunity for someone who has a passion for building a leading-edge data platform and is driven to work as an individual contributor and a great team player. We foster an environment that empowers small teams to collaboratively set the technical direction of our solutions. Responsibilities: Design, build, deploy, and operate next-generation data infrastructure. Develop and promote Apache Kafka best practices in the Data platform. Collaborate with engineers and analysts to ensure that our data infrastructure meets the needs of our most data-intensive customers Develop techniques for monitoring the correctness and reliability of our data infrastructure Leverage agile practices, encourage collaboration, prioritization, and urgency to develop at a rapid pace Research, share, and recommend new technologies and trends You know you’re the right fit if… You've worked with Apache Kafka in production You have excellent SQL skills and have worked with change data capture systems in production You have experience working with Infrastructure as Code, configuration management, and monitoring tools. Our team uses Terraform, Ansible, and Datadog. You have some experience working with languages like Python or Ruby. You care about work-life balance and want your company to care about it too; you'll put in the extra hour when needed but won't let it become a habit. You want to work with a high degree of autonomy, while at the same time working on initiatives of high importance to the company. Additional Skills and Knowledge: Experience with Confluent, Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, or KSQLDB is desirable Experience with CDC (change data capture) systems in general, or Debezium in particular, is highly desirable. Experience with clickstream tracking technology in general, or Snowplow in particular, is desirable. Experience with data warehouse technology is desirable, particularly with Snowflake. Experience in visualization tools like tableau Experience with containers and container orchestration tools. Docker and Kubernetes experience, in particular, is desirable. Light data science skills for analyzing data and communicating with ML engineers are a plus. Nice to Have: Bachelors in Computer Science or other quantitative fields. Experience working across all levels of the development stack Experience with AWS If you are interested in creating exceptional SaaS products, and contributing to a successful company, apply today! Our Story AppFolio (NASDAQ: APPF) was founded in 2006 with the mission to revolutionize vertical industry businesses by providing great software and service. Our easy-to-use, cloud-based software helps our customers more effectively market, manage, and grow their businesses. Our software solutions exist in the real estate vertical, including AppFolio Property Manager and AppFolio Investment Management.  To find out more about what AppFolio has to offer, check out appfolioinc.com/careers.

This is an exciting time to join Portland General Electric. As Oregon’s largest electric utility, Portland General Electric is leading an energy transformation that will harness the power of clean and renewable resources. Our vision for a clean energy future relies on three interrelated and overarching strategies: de-carbonize through investing in clean and reliable energy; modernize through a smarter more resilient grid; and empower our customers in their energy technology choices. We’re searching for innovative, customer and results-obsessed leaders to help power our mission and lead the way in championing the world’s clean energy future! Associate Data Scientist  The Data Strategy & Management (DSM) bears critical responsibility on behalf of Portland General Electric (PGE) to create value for customers, regulators, and business operations through the collection, organization, and interpretation of data from PGE’s expansive data portfolio. The mission of our team is to enable data driven decisions across the company and external stakeholders by ensuring secure, reliable and cataloged data access from our data lake and delivering insights utilizing advanced AI/ML approaches to support achieving PGE’s goal to provide energy that is safe, clean, reliable, affordable and secure. We are looking for an Associate Data Scientist to join our team and drive our mission together. This individual will collaborate with the business partners to answer their business questions by using advanced data analysis techniques. They will work closely with the Information Architect, Data Architect, Data Engineer, and Business SME’s to design and develop ML solutions to cater business values and end-user experience. Through their work, they will lay foundation of best practices and framework that other scientists can follow. The ideal candidate is proficient at manipulating and analyzing large datasets over multiple domains, and skilled at using various machine learning and statistical techniques to create solutions realizing clear business values. They must also be experienced at productionizing ML solutions. They must be comfortable at designing programmatic solutions from ambiguity, and able to convey their idea clearly to stakeholders. They should be great communicators and presenters even to high-level executives. Last but not the least, they should share the same passion to make the world a great place to live by providing clean and reliable energy to people. Career Level Summary Performs first-tier professional-level assignments that require theoretical knowledge and application of principles and concepts. Typically requires a related college or university degree or the equivalent work experience. Solves recurring problems by applying advanced knowledge. Operates independently but also receives ongoing guidance and direction from others Key Responsibilities Data Collection - With direction from senior colleagues, assists in identifying what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources; supports data collection, integration and retention requirements based on the input received; ensures information used follows PGE compliance, access management and control policies and meets PGE qualification and assurance requirements. Develop cost-benefit models to justify the data purchase/collation. Collaborate with Stakeholders - Works with peers and business stakeholders to identify the business requirements and expected outcomes. With peer and business stakeholder support, models and frames meaningful and impactful business scenarios for critical business processes and/or decisions. Analyze Data - Assists in developing data and analytics products to improve how business is conducted and increases throughput through operational efficiencies. Employs appropriate algorithms to discover patterns; uses statistical and data mining packages and dedicated frameworks. Shares data quality findings with data stewards and partners with data stewards on data quality definition and standards; includes experimental design approaches to validate findings by comparing appropriate samples. Assists in developing approaches for validation. Educate - Follow the overall data science standards, guidelines, best practices and approved modeling techniques. Suggests improvements as necessary. Education / Experience / Certifications Requires a Master of Science (MSc) degree in mathematics, statistics or computer science or related field, such as physics, economics, or operations research. Typically, entry level or academic experience or preparation to three years of practical experience in a business setting. Prototyping experience and extensive data analysis experience required. Knowledge of cloud platforms preferred. #LI-CU Join us today and power your potential! To be considered for this position, please complete the following employment application by the posting close date. A cover letter may be needed with your application to be considered for this position. PGE believes in rewarding strong performance. We provide a total compensation package that is designed to reward your contributions to the company, and, at the same time, support your well-being and professional development, both now and into the future. PGE is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. PGE will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law. Assisting with storms or other Company emergencies is a part of all positions at Portland General Electric. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee discount Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Referral program Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Education: Master's (Preferred) Experience: Python: 1 year (Preferred) SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Data, Research & Insights Data & Insights Leadership The Freemium R&D team oversees the entire user journey on Spotify and ensures we engage with people in innovative ways, every step of the way. Our team grows Spotify’s audience by finding future listeners around the world and delivering the right value to them, at the right time. With research, product development, product design, engineering, and marketing all collaborating in one organization, we’re able to quickly create meaningful features and services for millions of people around the world, resulting in joyful, long-lasting relationships with Spotify. Location Berlin or Remote EMEA Job type Permanent As a global growth team, we frequently work on the top priorities for the whole company and influence the experience of music listeners all around the world, from newly launched emerging markets to our most mature markets.  You will be a key leader in the organization charged with understanding how user needs and expectations are changing in the dynamic media landscape, and how well Spotify is matching the needs of diverse audiences from Japanese super fans to youth in Indonesia. What You'll Do Lead a team of some of the best user researchers and data scientists in the industry on a quest to produce the small and big data that power Spotify’s growth. Join a cross-functional leadership team of Design, Tech, and Product leaders and deliver complex, mixed methods learning strategies. Lead exploratory projects to imagine new experiences to users, triangulating the growth impact, revenue impact, and user needs. Deliver experimentation and measurement strategies for product features that are being launched to hundreds of millions of users around the world. Represent the work of your team to senior leadership in the organization and in the company, contribute thought leadership to the larger insights practice, and provide strong people leadership to insights practitioners in your team. Who You Are Have a passion and a vision for generating insights in the intersection of business and product development. Possess strong commercial competence and desire to work with insights partners outside of R&D in business analysis and consumer insights. Thrive in exploratory spaces where problems may lack definition and are able to create a vision and frameworks that guide teams in solving user and business problems effectively. You have experience in running complex experiments at large scale and are able to move quickly without compromising the integrity of insights work. You deeply value and have experience with hiring, coaching, and leading diverse and successful teams. A background in Data Science and/or User Research with ability to instill a culture of rigor and excellence in mixed methods insights work. 5+ years of experience with leading insights teams in quantitative and/or qualitative methods. Where You'll Be We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them! Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the EMEA region in which we have a work location Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here. Working hours? We operate within the Central European time zone for collaboration We ask that our team members be located within Greenwich Mean time zone, Central European time zone, or Eastern European standard time zone for the purposes of our collaboration hours Our global benefits Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse. Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success. Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents. All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub. Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs. Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events. Learn about life at Spotify Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens. Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.

Job Description  SATG is the Software and Advanced Technology group. Within that group, the Developer Ecosystems team engages with the developer community to drive broad education and adoption of oneAPI Software and Tools. This role sits within the Ecosystem Programs Teams and will lead the new Intel AI Developer Program team and drive broad developer education and adoption programs within the software developer community. We are seeking a dynamic leader to lead this new initiative and to lead a team in the creation and delivery of technical training, community building and developer evangelism through workshops, sample codes and enabling, conference speakerships, meet-ups, scale training platforms, blogs and direct community outreach. You will be responsible for building an industry leading team and executing a global developer education and enabling program. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's with 10+ years in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering or related technical discipline. 5+ years with the following skills: Team management and leadership experience SW development in C, C++ and Python with completed projects Delivering solutions in Deep learning, AI, Classical ML and Data science. Creating technical training content with compelling code samples and demos Conducting training workshops, webinars, hackathons, meet-ups Public presentations to large size audience Software evangelism and building developer communities This position is not eligible for an Intel immigration sponsorship. Preferred Qualifications: A strong reputation and following in AI developer communities Inside this Business Group Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software. Why Vacasa  We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in North America thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.  What we're looking for  A seasoned Machine Learning Engineering Lead with Intelligence, humility, candor, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment. You like to get things right and ship things quickly, but you can appropriately balance the inherent conflict between the two.  What you'll do as a leader  You'll use your knowledge of data science and machine learning algorithms to help our nimble team solve problems like how we build models to dynamically charge the right price for each of our 30,000+ units for each of 540 days into the future, how we rank our units on our search engine results pages in order to maximize guest conversion rate and revenue, and how we estimate how much a prospective home might be able to make as a Vacasa rental based on its characteristics and location.  Specifically, you'll:   Work with your team to deliver robust products  Manage a team of machine learning software engineers  Be an effective bridge between Product and the rest of your team  Manage change and contingencies for your team with a Product Manager  Participate in and encourage collaborative conversations around problem-solving  Provide a productive outlook and ensure all voices are heard to shape your team's culture  Provide guidance and mentorship to other software engineers on your team  Handle disputes and debates fairly and provide timely and direct feedback to all team members  Foster a tech culture where you lead by example   What you'll need   Extensive experience working on software projects with a cross-functional team  Adept at facilitating technical discussions that lead to informed decisions  Experience or enthusiasm to mentor engineers  Demonstrable experience delivering software products used in real-world environments  At least five years of combined data science and engineering experience with at least three of those on a machine learning team required  Expert-level SQL/Redshift  Strong python experience  Expert-level knowledge of data science libraries such as pandas, numpy, tensor-flow / keras or pytorch, scikit-learn, plotly (or equivalent)  Strong familiarity with a gamut of data science and machine learning approaches, including neural networks, random forest and GBTs, KNNs, k-means clustering, various types of regressions, and Bayesian techniques  Ability to function in a "big data" environment including an intermediate to expert knowledge of Spark or the ability and interest to quickly learn it on-the-job  Familiarity with AWS ecosystem and tools such as Glue, SageMaker, Athena, and Fargate  Familiarity with Docker or other container systems  Ability to work from home and resides in one of the followings states: AK, AL, AZ, CA, DE, FL, GA, HI, ID, IL, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MT, NC, NH, NM, NV, NY, OH, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WI, or WY.   What you'll get   Health/dental/vision insurance—employee & family coverage options  Employer Sponsored & Voluntary Supplemental Benefits  401K retirement savings plan with immediate 100% company match on the first 6% you contribute  Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts  Paid vacation & sick days  Paid holidays  Paid parental leave after one year of tenure  Employee Assistance Program  Career advancement opportunities  Employee discounts  All the equipment you'll need to be successful  Great colleagues and culture   Please visit our careers page to review our full benefits offerings  #li-remote  Vacasa is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or other classes protected by applicable law.  Vacasa is committed to maintaining a safe and productive work environment. Possession, use, or being under the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace is prohibited.  An offer of employment for this role will be contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.

Title: Senior Product Analyst, RCM Analytics This position is based remotely anywhere in the U.S. Overview of Position The Senior Product Analyst will be responsible for providing true intelligence and own select analytics user interfaces in our (RCM) Revenue Cycle Management Analytics product solutions for Change Healthcare, reporting to the VP of Engineering, Platform Integration Services. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data intelligence within the healthcare space with a focus on results, a self-starter, able to put the customer first, team first. Master’s degree in a STEM discipline, or equivalent practical experience 5+ years' experience in Business Intelligence (e.g., Spotfire, Tableau, Excel, PowerBI) with sound visualization techniques (having Stephen Few books at your bedside) Experience translating business questions to analytics questions and driving data-driven answers through statistical techniques and data mining Experience managing internal client-facing projects, troubleshooting technical issues, working with cross-functional stakeholders   What other skills/experience that would be helpful to have? LinkedIn SQL skill badge AWS certification (e.g., S3, Glue, QuickSight) Scrum Master certification Experience in writing software in one or more languages: Python, Java, C/C++, Go Healthcare Industry experience #li-remote Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system! Position Title: IS Data Engineer  Department: Business Intelligence Title of Manager: IS Development Manager  Supervises: Non-Supervisory  Exemption Status: Exempt  Requisition: 16690   General Statement of Duties The IS Data Engineer plays a pivotal role in operationalizing and advancing data and analytics for CareOregon’s business initiatives. This involves building, managing and optimizing data pipelines and moving them effectively into production for data and analytics consumers. Consumers include business data analysts, data scientists and other roles that need curated data for data and analytics use cases. The IS Data Engineer ensures compliance with data governance and data security requirements while enabling faster data access, integrated data reuse and acceleration of time-to-solution for CareOregon’s data and analytics initiatives.   Essential Position Functions  Create, maintain and optimize data pipelines as workloads move from development to production for specific use cases. Manage data pipelines through stages, beginning with ingestion of data sources through integration to consumption for specific use cases. Utilize innovative tools, techniques and architectures to partially or completely automate tasks in order to minimize manual processes, reduce the potential for error and improve productivity. Assist with the renovation of data management infrastructure that supports automation in data integration and management.  Partner with other Information Systems teams, business data analysts and other data and analytics consumers to refine their data requirements for initiatives and consumption.  Train data and analytics consumers about data pipelines and preparation techniques to make it easier for them to integrate and consume the data they need for their own use cases.  Apply understanding of data and domains to address emerging data requirements. Propose innovative data ingestion, preparation, integration and operationalization techniques to optimally address data requirements.  Promote CareOregon’s available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to IS staff and department leaders. Collaborate with and educate staff and leadership on how to leverage data and analytics capabilities to achieve business goals.   Essential Department and Organizational Functions  Propose and implement process improvements.  Meet deadlines for completion of workload.  Maintain agreed upon work schedule.  Demonstrate cooperation and teamwork.  Provide cross-training on specific job responsibilities.  Meet identified business goals that contribute to departmental goals.  Perform other duties as needed.   Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required  Strong ability to design, build and manage data pipelines for data structures encompassing data transformation, data models, schemas, metadata and workload management Strong ability to work with IT and business staff to integrate analytics and data science output into business processes and workflows  Strong ability to partner with data science teams to leverage data science and refine and optimize machine learning models and algorithms  Strong ability to collaborate with data governance, quality and security experts to move data pipelines into production in compliance with applicable standards and certification In depth knowledge of commonly used database programming languages for relational databases (e.g. SQL)  In depth knowledge of commonly used cloud-based data warehouse platforms (e.g. Snowflake, Redshift, etc.)  Ability to work across multiple deployment environments including cloud, on-premises and hybrid Ability to work with multiple operating systems and containerization platforms (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, AWS Elastic Container Service, etc.)  Ability to develop using Microsoft Azure products (e.g. Data Factory, Functions, Databricks, Monitor, etc.)  Ability to work with large, heterogeneous datasets to build and optimize data pipelines, pipeline architectures and integrated datasets Ability to extract business value while considering automation opportunities  Adept in the use of traditional data integration technologies including ETL/ELT, data replication/CDC and API design and access  Strong ability to work with and optimize existing ETL/ELT processes and data integration, data preparation flows and helping to move them into production  Strong ability to work with analytics tools for object-oriented/object function scripting using R, Python, Java, Scala and/or similar languages  Understanding of business intelligence solutions including working knowledge of commonly used data discovery, analytics and BI software tools for semantic layer-based data discovery (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.)  Strong ability to apply Agile methodologies  Ability to apply DevOps practices and tools and DataOps principles to data pipelines to improve data flows Knowledge of emerging data ingestion and integration technologies  Possess curiosity and desire for ongoing learning about new data initiatives and how to address them Ability to continually learn the latest versions of development tools and software products Excellent written and oral communication skills  Ability to successfully manage multiple tasks, concurrent high priority projects and continuous deadlines  Possess a high degree of initiative, motivation, self-discipline and good judgment  Knowledge of the basic concepts of managed care preferred  Knowledge of health insurance business entities, relationships and processes preferred   Physical Skills and Abilities Lifting/Carrying up to 0 Pounds  Pushing/Pulling up to situation and seek or determine appropriate resolution, accept managerial direction and feedback, and tolerate and manage stress.   Education and/or Experience  Required:  Minimum 5 years’ experience in data management required in roles that included all or most of the following functions:  Utilization of data integration, modeling, optimization and data quality improvement processes  Design of data and information architecture that delivers large (multi-terabyte) enterprise data warehouse solutions integrating many heterogeneous data sources Development utilizing tools such as Microsoft SQL Server, Snowflake and/or similar tools Development using Microsoft Azure products such as Data Factory, Functions, Databricks, Monitor and/or similar products  Data warehouse technical development that encompasses the data management life cycle and establishes end-to-end data warehousing, data management and analytics architecture Preferred:  Data management experience within the healthcare industry preferred. When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals. Location/Division Specific Information Sr. Solutions Owner, based out of our Carlsbad, CA location, plays a key role in BI Delivery organization providing business continuity for critical business processes, IT systems and IT solutions through project implementations, enhancements and documentation. The Sr. Solutions Owner will be techno functional and work closely with business users to collect requirements and create scalable and optimum BI solutions. He / She is a creative thinker and able to visualize the hidden insights in data. The Sr. Solutions Owner will design, develop and implement solutions that will drive actionable insights. How will you make an impact? Being part of an organization that provides analytics driven data solutions for all businesses across Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will be instrumental in helping our business partners and customers with their data and analytics needs. What will you do? Own and deliver solutions for Analytical Instrument Group (AIG) business processes and data needs. Defining, designing and documenting reference architecture and leading the implementation of BI and analytical solutions. Collaborate with BI admins, developers and analysts for successful project delivery Develop security and authentication BI process for organization. Identify, troubleshoot and resolve BI capacity issues related to BI tools. Brings experienced point of view on differing BI architectures and tool and develops solutions based on client use cases. Defines BI standards, guidelines and best practices for technical teams to achieve maximum efficiency. Supports in developing BI roadmap as per project prioritization and budget. Collaborate with DWH manager and data analysts to ensure data quality and integrity in DWH platforms for BI reporting. Ensure data quality and integrity before releasing to production. Proactively addresses scalability and performance issues. Mentors BI analysts on emerging BI tools. Build and enhance solutions using PySpark/EMR, SQL and databases, Oracle Golden Gate, AWS Athena, S3, Redshift, AWS API Gateway, Lambda, Glue and other Data Engineering technologies. Follow agile development methodologies to deliver solutions and product features by following DevOps practices. How will you get here? Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science with at least 7+ years of Solutions Ownership experience using AWS services in Big data platform. Full life cycle project implementation experience in AWS using PySpark/EMR, Athena, S3, Redshift, AWS API Gateway, Lambda, Glue and other managed services Experience using Jira for task prioritization and Confluence and other tools for documentation. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities 5+ years working experience in delivering BI solutions. BS degree in CS, CE or related field. 2+ years of Experience building Cloud BI solutions using AWS and Azure as data lake backend sources and understanding of Tableau, Domo, Power BI as BI visualization tools Expert in SQL queries Knowledge of DWH concepts and ETL development. Experience installing, configuring and managing BI platforms Knowledge of API enhancements to BI Platform. Demonstrated experience in defining and designing KPI metrics. Strong hands on experience with BI tools like Domo, Business Objects, Power BI and Tableau Working knowledge of relational database design and data modeling. Experience with agile development methodologies by following DevOps, Data Ops and Dev Sec Ops practices. Excellent written, verbal and inter-personal and stakeholder communication skills. Ability to analyze trends associated with huge datasets. Ability to work with cross functional teams from multiple regions/ time zones by effectively leveraging multi-form communication (Email, MS Teams for voice and chat, meetings) Excellent prioritization and problem solving skills.

Your Opportunity We seek a Senior Data Analyst to build a fresh pathway to understanding for data-hungry business leaders. Our Data Operating System Team is passionate about serving our 14,000+ customers, as well as crafting a bespoke Enterprise customer experience. As an experienced problem-solver working with Finance and Accounting stakeholders, transform how we use data to understand, take action, and optimize our business! In addition to our central San Francisco location (expected to open up again in 2022), remote candidates who can work West Coast hours from a home office where New Relic can do business are welcome to apply. What You’ll Do Perform exploratory data analysis of new data sources to gain a deeper understanding of how that data will advise business decisions. Transform data to make it more universally usable for all analysts in the company. Work closely with Data Engineers/Scientists in order to automate the collection and analysis of the raw data required for the models you build. Routinely write efficient, legible, and well-commented SQL. Create useful self-service dashboards for business partners. Clearly scope, track, execute, and communicate on projects in an Agile environment. Partner with business owners in marketing, product, finance, sales, engineering, etc, to extract and analyze data from large data tables using SQL, Excel, Python, or R to translate findings into actions. Your Qualifications Must-have: 3-4 years  writing sophisticated queries with  SQL. 2+ years experience communicating analytical findings to executives,  including metric dashboarding, storytelling, and presentation skills, making recommendations based on data-backed insights. Experience with some of these dataset types or specific tools : CRM (Salesforce/Gainsight), Billing Systems (Zuora), and Financial Planning (Anaplan). Superb ability to explain  “what it is,” “why it matters,” and “what should we do,” in terms of data and analysis to a non-technical audience! Connecting data sources and building dashboards in Tableau. Nice-to-have:  Growth metrics knowledge and use of SaaS Pirate metrics, calculations, and definitions (AARRR). 1+ year of Python/R/SAS/SPSS experience, understanding how to use statistical and machine learning packages. Use of Periscope Data, Looker, Mode Analytics, JIRA (tickets), Airflow (Data ETL), Redshift, and/or Snowflake. Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position. job_title: Principal Reimbursement BI Data Analyst PSJH
job_Description: Description:  Providence St. Joseph Health is calling a Principal Reimbursement BI Data Analyst PSJH to our location in Renton, WA; Portland, OR; Irvine, CA or Beaverton, OR.   *Other locations within the Providence footprint considered  We are seeking a Principal Reimbursement BI Data Analyst PSJH who will be in an advanced level individual contributor that is part of the Reimbursement Financial reporting team specializing in revenue analysis. The Reimbursement team is responsible for all accounting and analytics regarding revenue for PSJH's $24b revenue portfolio. The Principal Reimbursement BI Data Analyst is responsible for providing back and front end design, development, testing, training and deployment data support to all reimbursement pillars including data extracts, complex analysis, and forward looking analytics in partnership with other Finance, Revenue Cycle, Payor Contracting, IT, Security and HI departments. This role will also help leadership prioritize projects for the successful execution and deployment of those solutions based on the team's resource availability and the organizations objectives. Requires expert knowledge, skills and abilities in the areas of Finance, Reimbursement and Revenue Cycle Reporting, Analysis, Organization Hierarchy, Organizational Crosswalks/Mapping, Reporting Hierarchy, on-premise and cloud-based systems, security, access and data staging across multiple EMR and Finance systems and regions. This role will be heavily focused on data staging, data manipulation, data cleansing, analysis at scale, and process optimization and will serve as a liaison to other IT and Healthcare intelligence teams. Responsible for transforming data into information, as well as providing insights into changes in business for now and into the future. This role will serve as the principle or lead BI Data Analyst for researching and developing new and emerging technologies and solutions that will enable scalable, secure and user friendly adoption of those tools, technologies and platforms. This role designs, develops, deploys and supports sustainable BI solutions such as dashboards, scorecards and various other forms of data visualization and will act as the sign-off or approver of new solutions prior to production deployments to ensure quality and scalable solutions. This Industry Expert will be responsible for leading others on the team to apply their knowledge, technique, or expertise to support the organizations vision and strategic direction. Leads other BI developers and analysts in developing processes and data flows via architecture guidance, design, code reviews and estimation, planning and assignments for incoming project requests. Initiates peer code reviews, development of standards, guidelines and best practices for use of certain tools, technologies and techniques. In collaboration with management and other IT teams, this role will help establish best practices and standards for exporting data to 3rd party vendors and/or consultant companies for any projects where we need to send data outside our Providence St. Joseph networks. This requires knowledge in data security and SFTP transmission policies and procedures.  In this position you will have the following responsibilities:  Lead analyzing complex revenue streams and drawing conclusion regarding key drivers. Align solutions with other departments data needs and emerging new technologies.  Support other pillars of reimbursement by proving data extracts, data analysis, process design, and logical model development.  Serve as a lead liaison between the Reimbursement Department and Payor Contracting, IT, Security, Compliance and HI teams.  Lead the design, development, testing and deployment of tools for end user that allow end users that do not understand "big data" structures to use and analyze large amounts of complex data in quick and meaningful sessions.  Communicate operational results to levels of leadership ranging from local leadership to senior and executive system leadership and recommend changes to operations system initiatives that can improve and monitor organizational performance.  Approve recommended processes within finance to identify inefficiencies that transition tasks into data driven approaches.  Lead evaluations and preparation of various reimbursement optimization strategies and makes recommendations that positively impact existing reimbursement schemes.  Lead special projects and provide analytical support for Reimbursement, Finance and Revenue Cycle leadership.  Keeps the Manager apprised of issues within the office and seeks assistance in a timely manner such that critical deadlines are kept.  Direct leadership and training provided to other analyst levels. Assist manager/director in managerial tasks as assigned.  Provide inspiration from leadership perspective for innovative outside the box thinking to streamline complex tasks into scalable, data driven solutions.  Accomplish technical reviews and evaluate developer deliverables for correctness, consistency, and completeness as related to solution architecture and shall recommend changes as appropriate to Reimbursement leadership.  Design, develop, test and deploy data warehousing/business intelligence toolsets to gather, store, and provide access to data for Finance/Reimbursement management decision making. This role also designs, develops, tests, deploys and supports complex measure algorithms in the form of advanced SQL scripts and database queries.  Gain consensus and agreement with business units and senior management to conduct needs assessment to support organization strategies, tactics, and learning solutions that support Finance/Reimbursement and Revenue Cycle Objectives.  Prioritizes/assigns complex and advanced data manipulation tasks using available and most appropriate data management tools such as SAP HANA, Lumira, WEBI, Tableau, Informatica, TFS or SQL queries and database stored procedures. Development and maintenance of MS Access database platform and Visual Basic concepts and code.  May be required to participate in an on-call rotation to respond to and fix data refresh and application functionality issues as needed for our automated systems and the business users we support.  Qualifications:  Required qualifications for this position include:  Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Data Science, Business Information Systems or Mathematics/Statistics or equivalent education/experience.  7 years Demonstrated experience in the healthcare finance, data analytics or related field.  Epic Clarity Certification.  3 years SQL and/or other data query and analysis tools.  3 years Big data analysis and architecture experience.  Preferred qualifications for this position include:  Master's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Data Science, Business Information Systems or Mathematics/Statistics. Or equivalent education/experience. job_title: Data Center AI Group Central Finance Specialist
job_Description: Job Description Intel is a company of bold and curious inventors and problem solvers who create some of the most astounding technology advancements and experiences in the world. With a legacy of relentless innovation and a commitment to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth, our diverse and brilliant teams are continually searching for tomorrow's technology and revel in the challenge that changing the world for the better brings. Intel Finance prides itself on creating an environment where you are challenged to become the most well rounded, effective finance professional you can be. When you join Intel Finance, you can expect to support both brilliant technologists and top finance leaders who are working to change the world by creating leading edge technology. This Finance Specialist position will have a leadership role in delivering and influencing the Data Center and Artificial Intelligence Group (DCAI) P&L and investment portfolio, supporting key product lines of Xeon Server, FPGA, Memory and AI. The position entails a wide array of responsibilities, including but not limited to: Project manage short- and long-term financial planning and reporting cycles across DCAI business groups Leverage systems and models to consolidate financial data, pulling together P&L results and financial outlook Collaborate across the DCAI and Intel finance team to analyze financial impacts of business changes, deliver margin walks and scenario assessments. Lead DCAI gross investment processes and deliverables across resource and product portfolios Create executive-level materials to effectively communicate DCAI’s financial position, including KPIs and risks/opportunities Partner with cross-functional and cross-product teams to influence positive financial improvement through ROI/NPV analysis and goal setting The role will communicate complex business dynamics and make recommendations to senior executives, which will require building foundational knowledge of Intel’s Data Center and AI businesses, including competitive environment and market landscape. This is an excellent opportunity to manage ambiguity and learn within the fast-paced, exciting Data Center and AI industry environment. Put your portfolio of advanced financial modeling, accounting, business, and risk management skills into action to maximize Intel’s financial return. The successful candidate should demonstrate the following: Organized self-starter with the desire to learn and the motivation to take on new challenges Ability to manage significant amounts of data with attention to detail, while being able to up level and see the big picture Collaborative and able to partner with inputters and stakeholders to meet deliverables and critical timelines Excellent communication, analytical and problem-solving skills Aptitude for excel and ability to develop other tools expertise to support key reporting and planning processes Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Accounting, or related field 4+ years of previous Finance experience Preferred qualifications: MBA degree Experience in corporate finance or financial operations Project management experience or certification Experience in a global organization Inside this Business Group As members of the Finance team, employees act as full partners in making and supporting business decisions that are aimed at maximizing shareholder value. Intel Finance has a strong focus on facilitating change and improvement both within finance and in the operations supported. Intel Corporation will require all new U.S. employees to be fully-vaccinated for Covid-19 as a condition of hire unless they have an approved  accommodation  in place under applicable law. Newly-hired employees will be required to provide proof of vaccination prior to their start date. Posting Statement All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance. Position of Trust This role is a Position of Trust. Should you accept this position, you must consent to and pass an extended Background Investigation, which includes (subject to country law), extended education, SEC sanctions, and additional criminal and civil checks. For internals, this investigation may or may not be completed prior to starting the position. For additional questions, please contact your Recruiter....

Cascade Data Labs is a boutique consulting agency (operating as part of Kin + Carta) with end-to-end experience helping Fortune 500 companies form and execute their analytics strategy and infrastructure. We believe strongly that the difference between analytics success and failure comes down to practitioner-level understanding of the "details" presented across a variety of disciplines: data collection, organization, and engineering in a rapidly evolving technological landscape; analytical inference on multi-dimensional data sets; and the communication of findings to business stakeholders in visually compelling ways. As such,  we seek a new breed of data professionals  that can cut across these disciplines as project requirements dictate,  blurring the lines between data analyst, scientist, and engineer,  with the ability to work across a multitude of projects and contribute across various aspects of data product . While our culture promotes continual development and multidisciplinary growth, over time employees may gravitate towards a specific specialism and thrive in building a deep expertise in their domain of interest.  Ideal candidates will have strong quantitative backgrounds and analytical discipline. While they will have some demonstrated ability to write code, they will not have learned programming languages for the sake of building their resume, but rather as a means to express their intellectual curiosity and analytical voice. Cascade Data Labs will provide a platform and training to help them reach their full potential.  Core Responsibilities  Analyze a collection of raw data sets to create meaningful impact to large enterprise clients while maintaining a high degree of scientific rigor and discipline.  Engineer data pipelines and products to help stakeholders make and execute data driven decisions.  Communicate analytical findings in an intuitive and visually compelling way.  Potential Responsibilities (depending on aptitude, project, and seniority)  Creating highly visual and interactive dashboards via Tableau, PowerBI, or custom web applications  Conducting deep dive analysis and designing KPIs to help guide business decisions and measure success  Engineering data infrastructure, software libraries, and APIs supporting BI and ML data pipelines  Architecting cloud data platform components enabling the above  Building and tracking project timelines, dependences, and risks  Gathering stakeholder requirements and conducting technical due diligence toward designing pragmatic data-driven business solutions  Minimum Qualifications  We want all new hires to succeed in their roles at Kin + Carta. That's why we've outlined the job requirements below. To be considered for this role, it's important that you meet all Minimum Qualifications. If you do not meet all of the Preferred Qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.   Minimum of 2 years professional experience in data science, analytics, and/or engineering  Bachelors or Masters degree in quantitative studies including Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or computation-intensive Sciences and Humanities. Recent graduates should include GPAs in their resumes from degrees obtained in the last 5 years.  Proficiency (can execute data ingestion to insight) in programmatic languages such as SQL, Python, R  Preferred Qualifications  Proficiency in visualization/reporting tools such as Tableau and PowerBI or programmatic visualization library such as R ggplot2, Python matplotlib/seaborn/bokeh, Javascript D3.  Proficiency scripting in UNIX environment  Proficiency in big data environments and tools such as Spark, Hive, Impala, Pig, etc.  Proficiency with cloud architecture components (AWS, Azure, Google)  Proficiency with data pipeline software such as Airflow, Luigi, or Prefect  Ability to turn raw data and ambiguous business questions into distilled findings and recommendations for action  Experience with statistical and machine learning libraries along with the ability to apply them appropriately to business problems  Proficiency in front and back-end web application development stacks and frameworks (Javascript, HTML, CSS, React/Vue/AngularJS) including API design (REST/GraphQL) and library development  Experience leading and managing technical data/analytics/machine learning projects   Job Type:  Full-time  COVID-19 considerations: Employees are all working remotely at this time. Applicants must be able to relocate to the Portland area once the time is safe to do so.  About Kin + Carta  Kin + Carta exists to make the world work better by delivering transformative digital growth for our clients. As a digital transformation firm, we apply creativity, data, and technology to help clients invent, market, and operate new digital products and services that turn prospects into customers, and customers into advocates. Kin + Carta seamlessly integrates the strategic consulting, software engineering, and marketing technology needed to help businesses 'Make It Happen'.  Consultants at Kin + Carta have the opportunity to: engage with the most cutting-edge emerging technologies, solve difficult problems for some of the world's biggest companies, and work within a breadth of industries.  Kin + Carta is headquartered in Chicago and London with offices across four continents. Our culture and shared ways of working unite us globally, but it's our diverse specialisms, our connections, and our courage that makes our firm a recognized best place to work.  We welcome our Kin to show up as their full selves every day. Because this is so important to us, Kin + Carta is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. To read further about our commitment to Inclusion, Diversity, Equity, and Awareness, check out our IDEA page on our website.  If you need accommodations at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Operations Case Management & Analytics Lead Business Environment & Job Description: The HP PageWide Web Presses provide industry leading and revolutionary solutions built on HP Scalable PageWide Printing Technology. In the corrugate space, we have revolutionized the packaging industry by offering full-color, variable data printing at unprecedented speeds and media widths. In the High-Speed Commercial Print space, we offer exceptional versatility to address a broad range of applications, from general printing, to direct mail, to publishing, and beyond. Within the PageWide organization, the Customer Assurance and Growth team focuses on the technologies, solutions, processes, and support to help grow our customer’s success. We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced individual to apply their engineering knowledge and organizational skills to help with this mission. As the Case Management and Analytics Lead, you will be an integral part of a team responsible for helping to support our customers. In this role, you will administer the current case management system, and represent the organization in the transition to a new case management system. You will be responsible for helping to define, iterate, and improve case management processes, working to ensure that our customer needs are being met. Additionally, you will help lead out on initiatives to transform from reactive to proactive case management, partnering with R&D and Services on Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence initiatives, and analyzing the case data from the field and from early releases to detect possible class issues. Position Overview : We seek an experienced individual with a growth mindset to help establish and manage operational case management processes and analytics to improve the success and scalability of our products and support. In this role, you will be: Administering the Service Manager Toolset, and overseeing contractor support for maintaining the tool. Represent our organization’s interests and needs in the pan-HP initiative to move case management to ServiceNow.Work in partnership with Service and R&D to develop appropriate case management flows and processes that align with the new system and meet our needs. Partner and represent Operations in ongoing Case Management development projects, including the shift from reactive to proactive customer care. Help ensure that case processes are being followed, and that cases are being addressed and updated. Be a liaison and assist teams with analytics.Create KPIs and dashboards to help create paretos and detect field issues.Engage and partner with functional area teams and with service partners to look into suspicious patterns in the data.Communicate KPIs to management and partners. Lead other customer assurance initiatives to drive improvement and scalability in processes and quality, helping to detect issues easrly in the customer quality cycle. Domain Knowledge & Experience – Must Skills: Bachelor (undergraduate), Masters (graduate) or Ph.D (post-graduate) in a technical discipline (e.g, computer science, electrical engineering, data science) Knowledge and capability to administrate software toolsets. Power BI knowledge a plus. Analytical skills and ability to use scripting, excel, power BI and/or other tools to look for patterns in service data and press telemetry. Networking with/through other HP functions and businesses to optimize and deploy best case management and support practices Great organization skills, with the ability to lead contractors maintaining the Service Manager tool. Ability to organize & collect data, analyze, and communicate/summarize key results Exceptional written and oral communication – process documentation, engineering schedules, with the ability to target both internal and customer facing communications, etc. Team player, with a bias towards action.A willingness to engage, learn, and generally make things happen. Knowledge of Windchill, ServiceNow desirable #LI-POST About HP    You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.  So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.   HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.   Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.  From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!
